page.title: 17HOUSING.
page.content: There are a number of privately_owned properties in the village of Rhuallt. The most recent,a bungalow,having been completed approximately one year ago. One or two private houses are used as rented accomodation. One of the farms on the outskirts of the village is also rented,from the County. The majority of the housing is council owned.The buildings consist of family houses and bungalows for the elderly. A minority of the council houses have been bought by the previous tennants. The older population being static and no plans being envisaged to extend the estate,there is a drift of the young from the village to other areas. This reduction in the number of young families has contributed to the steady decline in numbers at the school,whose long-term future would seem to be in jeopardy.
